text: The Firjan (also al-Firjan) is an Arab tribe in Libya. They live in north- eastern Libya, with large populations in the Sirte, Ajdabiya and Benghazi districts.Gadhafi's Rule Relying on Wavering Tribal Support The tribe is divided into five sub-tribes. ==Libyan civil war== While many Firjani joined the revolt against Muammar Gaddafi (most notably in Ajdabiya and Benghazi) the status of others such as those in Sirte is uncertain. Khalifa Haftar, the current commander of the Libyan National Army is Firjani. His brother is the chief of the Firjan community in Benghazi.Gadhafi hometown a major obstacle in rebel advance ==References== * (1995), Tree of Ashraf Tribes in Libya, Nasab Newspaper (Morocco), p.6 Category:Arabs in Libya Category:Tribes of Libya Category:Libyan Civil War (2011)
title: Firjan
